sentence: In Ohio, the Senate race is crowded with wealthy Republican self-funders who have lent or donated money to their own campaigns: Mike Gibbons, an investment banker ($11.4 million); Jane Timken, a former party chair ($3.5 million); Bernie Moreno, a former car dealer ($3.75 million); and Matt Dolan, whose family owns the Cleveland Guardians ($10.5 million).
title: Billionaires and Big Checks Shape Battle for Congress

sentence: Chagrin Falls State Senator Matt Dolan with just about 10%, and former Ohio Republican Party Chairperson Jane Timken just under 10%.
author: Brandy Johanntges
title: Ohio Senate race heats up

sentence: Rob Portman (R-Ohio) on Wednesday endorsed former Ohio Republican Party chair Jane Timken in the race to succeed him, calling Timken “the best candidate to advance conservative Republican policies to help Ohio workers and families.” Timken has touted herself in TV ads as a “Trump conservative” and is one of several Republican candidates who have worked furiously to prove their fealty to the former president.
title: Ohio’s Sen. Portman backs former state GOP chair Jane Timken in race to succeed him

sentence: “Jane Timken is comfortable with establishment Republicans who make up a faction of our party, and with strong Trump Republicans who also are an important faction of our party, and that’s been true since becoming party chair,” he said.
title: Trump endorsement casts long shadow over Ohio Senate race

sentence: The candidates: Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Jane Timken, J.D.Vance and Matt Dolan will debate at FOX 8 News in Cleveland on March 21.
author: Jessica Bates
title: Ohio Republican Senate candidates to face off for the first time

sentence: Candidates who have committed to participate include Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, JD Vance, Matt Dolan and Jane Timken.
author: Mitch Davis
title: First News to air GOP Senate debate

sentence: Nexstar’s Ohio TV stations will host the hour-long debate with candidates Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Jane Timken, JD Vance and Matt Dolan at 7 p.m. on March 21.

title: 2 NEWS Ohio GOP Senate Debate: What are your questions for the candidates?

sentence: Nexstar’s Ohio TV stations will host the hour-long debate with candidates Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Jane Timken, JD Vance and Matt Dolan at 7 p.m. on March 21.
author: Darcie Loreno
title: Ohio GOP Senate Debate: What are your questions for the candidates?

sentence: “You don’t know squat,” Gibbons is heard jabbing at the former state treasurer’s experience in the private sector, after which Mandel, a veteran, responds, “Two tours in Iraq, don’t tell me I haven’t worked.” The men repeatedly told each other to back off before standing eye-to-eye for several seconds, while fellow GOP debate participants Matt Dolan, Jane Timken and JD Vance looked on awkwardly.
title: Ohio GOP Senate debate turns nasty as Gibbons and Mandel go nose-to-nose

sentence: Matt Dolan: “You don’t provide checks to people to stay home… When you get people back to work… That creates a downward pressure.” Jane Timken: “They acted like children… It will be a priority of mine to get back our energy independence.” Josh Mandel: “So instead of depending on radical Muslim nations, instead of depending on thugs like Putin…” He says we should be producing gas in Ohio.
